SWA Alto importer¶

This importer is a special case of Mets/Alto. Here, we only have ALTO.xml files, so only the Pages are in alto format. It was developed to handle OCR newspaper data in Alto format provided by the Schweizerisches Wirtschaftsarchiv (SWA) of Basel University Library.

Custom classes¶

class text_importer.importers.swa.classes.SWANewspaperIssue(issue_dir: text_importer.importers.swa.detect.IssueDirectory, temp_dir: str)¶

Class representing a SWA Newspaper Issue.

Note

SWA is in ALTO format, but there isn’t any Mets file. So in that case, issues are simply a collection of pages.

Parameters

  • issue_dir (SwaIssueDir) – SwaIssueDir of the current Issue

  • temp_dir (str) – Temporary directory to extract archives

class text_importer.importers.swa.classes.SWANewspaperPage(_id: str, number: int, alto_path: str)¶

Class representing a newspaper page in SWA data.

Parameters

  • alto_path (str) – Full path to the Alto XML file.

  • _id (str) – Canonical page ID (e.g. GDL-1900-01-02-a-p0004).

  • number (int) – Page number.

add_issue(issue: text_importer.importers.classes.NewspaperIssue)¶

Add to a page object its parent, i.e. the newspaper issue.

This allows each page to preserve contextual information coming from the newspaper issue.

Parameters

issue (NewspaperIssue) – Newspaper issue contaning this page.

property ci_id¶

Return the content item ID of the page.

Given that SWA data do not entail article-level segmentation, each page is considered as a content item. Thus, to mint the content item ID we take the canonical page ID and simply replace the “p” prefix with “i”.

Returns

str Content item id

parse()¶

Process the page file and transform into canonical format.

Note

This lazy behavior means that the page contents are not processed upon creation of the page object, but only once the parse() method is called.

Detect functions¶

text_importer.importers.swa.detect.SwaIssueDir¶

A light-weight data structure to represent a SWA newspaper issue.

This named tuple contains basic metadata about a newspaper issue. They can then be used to locate the relevant data in the filesystem or to create canonical identifiers for the issue and its pages.

Note

In case of newspaper published multiple times per day, a lowercase letter is used to indicate the edition number: ‘a’ for the first, ‘b’ for the second, etc.

Parameters

  • journal (str) – Newspaper ID

  • date (datetime.date) – Publication date

  • edition (str) – Edition of the newspaper issue (‘a’, ‘b’, ‘c’, etc.)

  • path (str) – Path to the archive holding issue’s data

  • rights (str) – Access rights on the data (open, closed, etc.)

  • pages (list) – List of tuples (page_canonical_id, alto_path), alto_path is the path from within the archive

>>> from datetime import date
>>> i = IssueDirectory(journal='arbeitgeber', date=datetime.date(1908, 7, 4), edition='a', path='./SWA/impresso_ocr/schwar_000059110_DSV01_1908.zip', rights='open_public',                         pages=[('arbeitgeber-1908-07-04-a-p0001', 'schwar_000059110_DSV01_1908/ocr/schwar_000059110_DSV01_1908_alto/BAU_1_000059110_1908_0001.xml'), ...])

alias of text_importer.importers.swa.detect.IssueDirectory

text_importer.importers.swa.detect.detect_issues(base_dir: str, access_rights: str, csv_file: str = 'impresso_ids.zip', archives_dir: str = 'impresso_ocr') → List[text_importer.importers.swa.detect.IssueDirectory]¶

Detect newspaper issues to import within the filesystem.

This function expects the directory structure that SWA used to organize the dump of Alto OCR data.

Todo

The access rights information is not in place yet, but needs to be specified by the content provider (SWA).

Parameters

  • base_dir (str) – Path to the base directory of newspaper data.

  • access_rights (str) – Path to access_rights.json file.

  • csv_file (str) – Compressed csv file holding Issue and page identifiers with alto paths (impresso_ids.zip as default)

  • archives_dir (str) – Directory where archives are stored (impresso_ocr/ as default)

Returns

List of SwaIssueDir instances, to be imported.

text_importer.importers.swa.detect.get_issuedir(row: pandas.core.series.Series, archives_full_dir: str) → Optional[text_importer.importers.swa.detect.IssueDirectory]¶

Creates a SwaIssueDir from a row of the csv file

Note

This function is called internally by detect_issues()

Parameters

  • row (pd.Series) – Path of issue.

  • archives_full_dir (str) – Path to archive for current issue

Returns

New `` object.

text_importer.importers.swa.detect.select_issues(base_dir: str, config: dict, access_rights: str) → List[text_importer.importers.swa.detect.IssueDirectory]¶

Detect selectively newspaper issues to import.

The behavior is very similar to detect_issues() with the only difference that config specifies some rules to filter the data to import. See this section for further details on how to configure filtering.

Todo

The access rights information is not in place yet, but needs to be specified by the content provider (SWA).

Parameters

  • base_dir (str) – Path to the base directory of newspaper data.

  • config (dict) – Config dictionary for filtering.

  • access_rights (str) – Path to access_rights.json file.

Returns

List of SwaIssueDir instances, to be imported.
